meanings.definition: Relating to the study of plant diseases.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted a phytopathological research on the effects of fungi on plants.
meanings.sent2: The phytopathological report highlighted the various diseases affecting the crops.
meanings.sent3: The phytopathological investigation into the mysterious wilting of the flowers revealed a mischievous caterpillar culprit.
meanings.sent4: Her garden, once vibrant and lush, now bore a phytopathological resemblance to a graveyard of sickly plants.
meanings.sent5: The phytopathological expertise of the botanist saved the orchard from a devastating outbreak.

meanings.definition: Causing or relating to plant diseases.
meanings.sent1: The phytopathological fungus spread rapidly, infecting the entire field of crops.
meanings.sent2: Farmers were concerned about the phytopathological effects of the new pesticide on their harvest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel's phytopathological antics involved digging up the freshly planted seeds.
meanings.sent4: The phytopathological blight descended upon the garden like a dark cloud, withering the once thriving plants.
meanings.sent5: The phytopathological nature of the invasive species threatened the delicate ecosystem of the forest.
